intro: Cardamine nymanii, commonly known as the narrowleaf water crowfoot, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Ranunculaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, trifoliate leaves that are typically submerged or floating on the surface of freshwater habitats. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers with five petals, which appear in early spring. Cardamine nymanii is often found in still or slow-moving waters, such as ponds and marshes, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its presence is an indicator of good water quality and healthy aquatic ecosystems.
